circumstances: Alfred Heft, test pilot by Junkers, was performing a local test flight on this De Havilland DH.60 Moth, the first British aircraft to be sold in Germany after the WWI. Shortly after takeoff from Berlin-Tempelhof, while in initial climb, the aircraft went out of control and crashed. The pilot, sole on board, was killed.
probable_cause: Reason for crash is unknown but this accident led to initial refusal by German authorities to certify the DH.60 Moth.
